content:
• Tuesday, January 31, 2012
  • CB

    More on Ace (ACE): Q4 beats estimates on all counts, despite a 25% decline in revenue on higher...

    More on Ace (ACE): Q4 beats estimates on all counts, despite a 25% decline in revenue on higher catasrophe losses. Operating income was better, coming in at $1.94 per share. Analysts had expected operating earnings of $1.78. Shares +2.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM
  • MPW

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Medical Properties Trust (NYSE:MPW) discloses it will acquire...

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Medical Properties Trust (NYSE:MPW) discloses it will acquire assets and make loans to Ernest Health for a total investment of $396.5M. The assets include five rehab facilities and seven long-term acute facilities, purchased for $200M. The company plans to partly finance its investments by issuing stock. MPW -5.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • HLIT

    More on Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT): Q4 comes in roughly in-line to slightly better on revenue. The...

    More on Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT): Q4 comes in roughly in-line to slightly better on revenue. The the stock is down in the post session however, after the company guides FQ1 revenue to the low side of estimates. It now expects to earn in the range of $132M - $142M. The Street is at $138M. Shares -5.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • UBNT

    More on Ubiquiti Networks' FQ2: In addition to beating FQ2 forecasts, the company is guiding for...

    More on Ubiquiti Networks' FQ2: In addition to beating FQ2 forecasts, the company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $89M-$91M and EPS of $0.27-$0.28, above a consensus of $87.8M and $0.25. However, with Ubiquiti trading near its 52-week high going into earnings, shares may have been priced to perfection. UBNT -8.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • AMZN

    Mentioned during Amazon's Q4 earnings call: The company ended Q4 with 56,200 employees, up 67%...

    Mentioned during Amazon's Q4 earnings call: The company ended Q4 with 56,200 employees, up 67% Y/Y. 17 fulfillment centers built in 2011, raising total to 69. Plans to keep up its aggressive investment pace. Video game revenue fell Y/Y. Company willing to buy back stock "at the right value." Still no details on Kindle Fire sales. AMZN -8.7% AH. (live blog) (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue to exceed $4.3B...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue to exceed $4.3B (consensus is for $4.34B). The company also expect FQ4 revenue to exceed $5B, and calendar 2012 sales to be roughly $20B. Shares now +3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • AZPN

    More on Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): Shares are hitting new 52-week highs after FQ2 earnings...

    More on Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): Shares are hitting new 52-week highs after FQ2 earnings blow out estimates. Revenue jumped 33% Y/Y on a 12% increase in its annual spend, which was largely due to the recognizing of revenue associated with a few large contracts with longstanding customers. Shares +11% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • KTCC

    Shares of Key Tronic (NASDAQ:KTCC) soar 26.8% AH after the firm reports FQ2 revenue of $84.5M,...

    Shares of Key Tronic (NASDAQ:KTCC) soar 26.8% AH after the firm reports FQ2 revenue of $84.5M, beating the consensus estimate of analysts for $61M by a wide margin. The tech concern says that it expects FQ3 revenue in the range of $92M-$97M, with EPS falling between $0.30 and $0.35 during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • FTNT

    More on Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q4 beats on a 29% Y/Y jump in revenue. Demand and growth were...

    More on Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q4 beats on a 29% Y/Y jump in revenue. Demand and growth were robust, with product and service revenue rising 40% and 27% respectively Y/Y, and total billings gaining 27% over the same period. Shares +8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • JDAS

    More on JDA Software's Q4: While JDA's top-line figure beat forecasts, its software and...

    More on JDA Software's Q4: While JDA's top-line figure beat forecasts, its software and subscription revenue fell 10% Y/Y, thanks to a 31% decline in sales to the Americas. Those figures might be unsettling the Street, especially since software sales leads to future services revenue. JDAS -8.4% AH. Update: JDA is also disclosing the SEC is "requesting information related to revenue recognition and other accounting and financial reporting matters." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    More on Amazon's Q4: North American sales +37% Y/Y (44% in Q3). International sales +31% (44% in...

    More on Amazon's Q4: North American sales +37% Y/Y (44% in Q3). International sales +31% (44% in Q3). Merchandise sales +48%, media sales +15%. Operating cash flow was $4.27B ($3.48B in year-ago period). Kindle device unit sales +177% Y/Y. (no specifics on Kindle Fire) Operating margin was 1.4%, down from 3.8% in year-ago period. AMZN -8.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM) Q4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.82B (-7% Y/Y) beats by $2M....

    Broadcom (BRCM) Q4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.82B (-7% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Expects Q1 revenue of $1.7B-$1.8B compared with $1.73B consensus. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $17.43B (+35% Y/Y) misses by...

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $17.43B (+35% Y/Y) misses by $780M. Expects Q1 revenue of $12B-$13.4B, largely below $13.4B consensus. Expects operating income of -$200M to $100M. Shares -8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 40 Comments
  • RTIX

    RTI Biologics (RTIX -13.5%) trades down into the close despite beating Q4 estimates. Profit...

    RTI Biologics (RTIX -13.5%) trades down into the close despite beating Q4 estimates. Profit actually declined 5.5% Y/Y due to inventory issues, which masked a 20% jump in international sales. The company warns on FY12 guidance however, now saying it expects revenue in the range of $174M - $176M. Analysts are looking for sales of $176M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • RGA

    Reinsurance Group of America (RGA -2.3%) trades down late in the day after its Q4 missed big on...

    Reinsurance Group of America (RGA -2.3%) trades down late in the day after its Q4 missed big on revenue. Earnings fell 19% Y/Y as core profit takes a hit from higher claims and lower investment income outstripped premium gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • CALL

    MagicJack (CALL +12.6%) shares hit a 17-month high as Oppenheimer starts coverage at Outperform...

    MagicJack (CALL +12.6%) shares hit a 17-month high as Oppenheimer starts coverage at Outperform with a $24 price target. Noting "very strong" sales thus far, the firm expects CALL to further expand its offerings and predicts sustained revenue and earnings growth of at least 20% annually, "helped by price increases and improved distribution."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CNH

    Shares of CNH Global (CNH -10%) slump after reporting an 8% Y/Y drop in its Q4 profit and saying...

    Shares of CNH Global (CNH -10%) slump after reporting an 8% Y/Y drop in its Q4 profit and saying demand for farm equipment could be flat this year. While results beat expectations, William Blair says CNH "had negative [operating] margins in construction when it should be turning the corner," and investors were concerned by its profit margins and 2012 outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • PCH

    Potlatch (PCH -7.3%) takes a hit after missing its Q4 estimates, swinging to a surprise loss on...

    Potlatch (PCH -7.3%) takes a hit after missing its Q4 estimates, swinging to a surprise loss on harvest deferrals due to depressed timber prices in its southern U.S. markets. The company also issues a cautious outlook for 2012, saying the housing market remains depressed and expects only a modest improvement in housing starts in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS +4.8%) grabs some attention from analysts after landing FDA approval for Erivedge....

    Curis (CRIS +4.8%) grabs some attention from analysts after landing FDA approval for Erivedge. Oppenheimer raised its rating to Outperform with a new price target of $7.50, while Summer Street reiterated a Buy rating with a $7 PT. Shares have sputtered since the news broke on a bit of buy-the-rumor, sell-the-news trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • AXE

    Anixter International (AXE -3%) trades lower on profit-taking, despite beating Q4 estimates on...

    Anixter International (AXE -3%) trades lower on profit-taking, despite beating Q4 estimates on an 8% Y/Y increase in revenue. Operating margins were healthy given the weak economic environment in many parts of the world, as the company capitalized on its diverse product line to offset isolated pockets of weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • ANDE

    Andersons (ANDE -7.2%) is lowered to Neutral from Overweight by Piper Jaffray, which notes...

    Andersons (ANDE -7.2%) is lowered to Neutral from Overweight by Piper Jaffray, which notes potential headwinds in H1 2012, including depressed ethanol production margins, lower margins in the plant nutrient segment, and a tight spread between cash prices and futures prices of grain. The firm lowers its price target for the shares to $45 from $55.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy Industries (AEIS -4.7%) trades lower after its Q4 revenue came up shy of...

    Advanced Energy Industries (AEIS -4.7%) trades lower after its Q4 revenue came up shy of estimates due to greater than anticipated restructuring charges and weaker capital spending by some of its core customers. Thin film sales declined 29% Y/Y,  primarily due to continued weak market conditions in solar panel and flat panel displays.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • PPO

    Axiom Capital kicks Polypore International (NYSE:PPO) while it's down - noting that the news on...

    Axiom Capital kicks Polypore International (NYSE:PPO) while it's down - noting that the news on customer LG Chem having its own separator plant up and running by H2 is "detrimental" to the firm's prospects. Investors seem to already have that idea well in mind - running shares down 28.6% on heavy volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • EQT

    EQT (EQT +1.6%) gains from an upgrade to Hold on valuation at Canaccord, citing a higher gas...

    EQT (EQT +1.6%) gains from an upgrade to Hold on valuation at Canaccord, citing a higher gas price realization, a greater liquids composition and refinements to midstream margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • AVY

    Label and tag maker Avery Dennison (AVY -5.7%) loses ground after its Q4 earnings miss the mark....

    Label and tag maker Avery Dennison (AVY -5.7%) loses ground after its Q4 earnings miss the mark. Profit fell 81% Y/Y on sales declines throughout its retail branding and specialty businesses. The company also lowers 2012 guidance, now expecting its EPS to come in between $1.80 - $2.15, below the Street view of $2.71.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • GNTX

    Shares of Gentex (GNTX -10.7%) fall sharply after the firm misses the estimates of analysts with...

    Shares of Gentex (GNTX -10.7%) fall sharply after the firm misses the estimates of analysts with its Q4 earnings report and warns about slowing production in China and Europe. The auto industry supplier also notes that it's still feeling a supply chain impact from the flooding in Thailand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • HP

    Driller Helmerich & Payne (HP +3.27%) moves up after its FQ1 earnings beats estimates....

    Driller Helmerich & Payne (HP +3.27%) moves up after its FQ1 earnings beats estimates. Profit rose an impressive 39% Y/Y as better performance from its U.S. land operations and a jump in rig utilization offset weaker numbers from its international land operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • AVP

    Avon Products (AVP -2.6%) discloses in a SEC filing (8-K) that it fired Vice Chairman Charles...

    Avon Products (AVP -2.6%) discloses in a SEC filing (8-K) that it fired Vice Chairman Charles Cramb in a move tied to allegations the exec was involved in an overseas bribery scheme. BMO Capital weighs in on the action by saying that the firing was needed to reestablish management credibility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • KLIC

    Kulicke & Soffa (KLIC -2.8%) trades down after missing on its FQ1 EPS but beating on...

    Kulicke & Soffa (KLIC -2.8%) trades down after missing on its FQ1 EPS but beating on revenue. Earnings fell 44% Y/Y on lower ball-bonder and wedge-bonder equipment sales. The company also lowers its forecast for the current quarter, now expecting revenues of $125M - $135M, below Street estimates of $137M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • BLKPF

    Canadian oil sands producer BlackPearl Resources (OTCPK:BLKPF) is down almost 9% on news that...

    Canadian oil sands producer BlackPearl Resources (OTCPK:BLKPF) is down almost 9% on news that 2011 exit production rate was 9,500 barrels per day vs. guidance of 11,000 bpd. Longer-term investors may want to take a look at the company today, as this production miss may be a small blip on the road to 30,000+ bpd of oil production by 2016. (submitted by Devon Shire)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • PPO

    Shares of Polypore International (PPO -25.1%) crater after rival LG Chem says it will have a...

    Shares of Polypore International (PPO -25.1%) crater after rival LG Chem says it will have a competing plant up and running by the second half of 2012. PPO set a 52-week low in intraday trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) comes off a trading halt after tripping circuit breaks...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) comes off a trading halt after tripping circuit breaks still showing a solid 7.4% gain on momentum built from the firm's FDA approval for Kalydeco. Sanford Bernstein analyst Geoffrey Porges sees more than just hype off the news: "The FDA is trying to demonstrate a willingness to move quickly on medicines that make a big difference and this is a big difference maker."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • MTH

    Meritage Homes (MTH -11%) tanks on heavy volume after its Q4 misses across the board, despite...

    Meritage Homes (MTH -11%) tanks on heavy volume after its Q4 misses across the board, despite posting stronger home closings and an increase in orders. Losses widened sharply on write-downs, related mostly to the winding down of its Las Vegas operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PNR

    Water treatment and storage manufacturer Pentair (PNR -1%) dips after its Q4 swings to a loss on...

    Water treatment and storage manufacturer Pentair (PNR -1%) dips after its Q4 swings to a loss on a $200M goodwill write-down. Revenue at its water segment actually grew on a 15% Y/Y jump in net sales, boosted by its recent acquisition of Clean Process Technologies, but the company warns of higher costs and softer-than-expected sales weakening its bottom line in future quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • MFRM

    KeyBanc goes to the mattresses for MFRM, TPX, SCSS, and ZZ - calling for strong industry-wide...

    KeyBanc goes to the mattresses for MFRM, TPX, SCSS, and ZZ - calling for strong industry-wide sales growth in 2012 after meeting with management in what it calls its "favorite" subsector. Sealy rates a Hold by analysts with KeyBanc, while Tempur-Pedic, Mattress Firm, and Select Comfort all come in with solid Buy ratings and improved price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • SPGI

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -1.4%) dips after its Q4 misses revenue estimates. Profit jumped 39% Y/Y as...

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -1.4%) dips after its Q4 misses revenue estimates. Profit jumped 39% Y/Y as sales increased for nearly all business units, including its long-struggling education arm, and due to a $74M gain related to the sale of its broadcasting group. However, credit-market volatility offset much of those gains, resulting in an 8% drop in adjusted operating profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • IPI

    Goldman Sachs downgrades Intrepid Potash (IPI -5.9%) to Sell from Neutral, noting concerns that...

    Goldman Sachs downgrades Intrepid Potash (IPI -5.9%) to Sell from Neutral, noting concerns that "further production cuts likely needed in order to balance the [potash] market," and anticipating the potential for downward Street EPS revisions. Goldman also downgrades Potash (POT -2%) to Neutral for similar reasons.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • UAA

    Needham raises its stock rating on Under Armour (UA +3.1%) to Buy from Hold, noting that it...

    Needham raises its stock rating on Under Armour (UA +3.1%) to Buy from Hold, noting that it expects the athletic apparel maker to "solidly exceed" its 2012 guidance, given management's history of conservative estimates, the brand's premium positioning and improving consumer sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • CIT

    CIT Group (CIT +2.2%) Q4 easily beats estimates, despite a 59% Y/Y drop in profit as the...

    CIT Group (CIT +2.2%) Q4 easily beats estimates, despite a 59% Y/Y drop in profit as the commercial lender saw reduced benefits from fresh-start accounting. However, a decline in problem loans and borrowing costs helped to beat analysts' expectations, as loan volume increased across all business segments, and it  redeemed about $860M of high-cost debt during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • SOL

    Solar stocks are heading lower following reports that German subsidy cuts could arrive by April...

    Solar stocks are heading lower following reports that German subsidy cuts could arrive by April (TAN -2.3%). Chinese names are among the biggest losers: SOL -7.2%. CSIQ -8.5%. TSL -7.8%. CSUN -5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (ICUI -1.3%) dips on a mixed Q4, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue. Earnings...

    ICU Medical (ICUI -1.3%) dips on a mixed Q4, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue. Earnings soared 79% Y/Y on one-time gain from the sale of its diabetes infusion set business, but sales growth has slowed in recent quarters as increasing global competition has put pressure on pricing and its ability to add and retain customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX +28.8%) skyrockets after stating it's making progress towards...

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX +28.8%) skyrockets after stating it's making progress towards meeting the FDA's software verification and validation requirements for the initiation of Phase 3 trials for its ARX-01 analgesia device, and that patient dosing should begin in late Q1 or early Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • HRS

    Military communications contractor Harris Corp. (HRS +3%) gains despite posting a mixed FQ2 on a...

    Military communications contractor Harris Corp. (HRS +3%) gains despite posting a mixed FQ2 on a decline in net earnings. Profit fell 12% Y/Y on slowing sales growth and a reduced order backlog. The company also lowers its FY12 revenue estimate, now expecting to earn $6B, down from its earlier forecast of around $6.15B - $6.3B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • DKS

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +1.1%) lands on JPMorgan's Focus List after analyst Christopher...

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +1.1%) lands on JPMorgan's Focus List after analyst Christopher Horvers crunches the numbers to find that both the firm and the Street came in low with estimates for Q4 and FY11 earnings. He sets a price target range of $45 to $50 on shares of DKS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +6.1%) lands FDA approval for its cystic fibrosis drug Kalydeco for...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +6.1%) lands FDA approval for its cystic fibrosis drug Kalydeco for patients over 6 years of age. Shares immediately spiked higher on the news - taking back ground lost yesterday after the firm's 2012 sales estimates for Incivek came in light.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • NBGGY

    Tales from an insolvent country: Today's 8.8% rise in the Athens 20 puts the index +17.4% YTD....

    Tales from an insolvent country: Today's 8.8% rise in the Athens 20 puts the index +17.4% YTD. The banking index rises 16% today, giving it a gain of 125% in the last 3 weeks. National Bank of Greece (NBG +12.4%) +83% YTD. The Greek ETF: GREK +36% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • CRVL

    CorVel (NASDAQ:CRVL), a provider of risk management services for businesses, falls 8.5% after...

    CorVel (NASDAQ:CRVL), a provider of risk management services for businesses, falls 8.5% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $101M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.47. The company's gross margin fell 360 bps Q/Q to 20.9%, a decline it blames on a mix shift towards lower-margin services.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • PAY

    Shares of VeriFone Systems (PAY +7.4%) take a leg up on word that Mastercard (MA +0.5%) seeks to...

    Shares of VeriFone Systems (PAY +7.4%) take a leg up on word that Mastercard (MA +0.5%) seeks to introduce a new credit card technology. The plan to use chips - instead of magnetic stripes - should be a revenue driver for VeriFone, according to JPMorgan.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM

  • Traders are testing the will of the SNB, driving the euro/franc exchange rate to CHF 1.2037, the...

    Traders are testing the will of the SNB, driving the euro/franc exchange rate to CHF 1.2037, the lowest level since the bank set a CHF 1.20 floor on the pair last fall. Since that bombshell move, the euro has mostly traded above 1.20 as punters waited for the SNB to raise the floor even higher. With Hildebrand's ouster, 1.20 may look challengeable.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH -28.9%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Janney, which says RSH is...

    RadioShack (RSH -28.9%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Janney, which says RSH is "seeing a somewhat dramatic shift to a structurally lower gross margin, and we are unclear where this shift will bottom out." The firm cites concerns over RSH's post-paid business with carrier partner Sprint (NYSE:S), which the company blamed for much of its weak guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    The on again, off again financing deal dance between Sears (SHLD -4.2%) and CIT Group (previous)...

    The on again, off again financing deal dance between Sears (SHLD -4.2%) and CIT Group (previous) continues with a new report tipping off that CIT may have pulled its factoring arrangement again.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • MSPD

    Mindspeed (MSPD +10.6%) takes off after delivering an FQ1 beat and guiding for FQ2 revenue of...

    Mindspeed (MSPD +10.6%) takes off after delivering an FQ1 beat and guiding for FQ2 revenue of $33.5M-$35.5M ($33.4M consensus). Like other chipmakers, Mindspeed claims demand is bottoming following the industry's recent inventory correction. Needham (Buy) sees Mindspeed's Transcede base station processors and recently-acquired Picochip division contributing to strong 2012 growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • BIIB

    Biogen (BIIB +1.8%) moves up after its Q4 easily beat EPS estimates earlier this morning....

    Biogen (BIIB +1.8%) moves up after its Q4 easily beat EPS estimates earlier this morning. Earnings rose 25% Y/Y on faster than expected revenue growth, helped by a jump in sales of Tysabri and Avonex. The company guides lower for FY12 however, saying revenue growth is showing signs of slowing. It now anticipates low-to mid-single-digit revenue growth in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • RDN

    S&P downgrades the credit ratings of several U.S. mortgage insurers, saying the outlook...

    S&P downgrades the credit ratings of several U.S. mortgage insurers, saying the outlook continues to be negative as the economy continues to show weakness in the job and housing markets. The ratings agency cuts Radian Group (RDN -5.1%) and MGIC Investment (MTG -1.1%) both by a notch to B (I, II), five ticks into junk territory.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • MNKD

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD -7.1%) get tripped up on news that the firm plans to issue $50M worth...

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD -7.1%) get tripped up on news that the firm plans to issue $50M worth of units consisting of common stock and warrants. The biopharmaceutical firm didn't specify the planned use of the funds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • MAUXF

    Oil producer Mart Resources (OTCPK:MAUXF), which had doubled in the past couple of months, is...

    Oil producer Mart Resources (OTCPK:MAUXF), which had doubled in the past couple of months, is down over 20% in early trading on news that a third of its production was shut in for the month of December. Additionally, Mart shareholders get a nasty surprise about "pipeline losses," which apparently are a risk to consider when investing in Nigerian oil producers. (submitted by Devon Shire)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • MAT

    Shares of Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) shoot up 5.9% after the toymaker knocks out an earnings beat and...

    Shares of Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) shoot up 5.9% after the toymaker knocks out an earnings beat and increases its annual dividend payout to $1.24 per share. Mattel now trades with a 3.97% yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SHLM

    Plastics supplier A. Schulman (SHLM +2.9%) adds to its European operations by acquiring French...

    Plastics supplier A. Schulman (SHLM +2.9%) adds to its European operations by acquiring French color maker Elian SAS for around $63M in cash. Elian makes formulated color concentrates used in health care, cosmetics, packaging, pipes and personal hygiene products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +5.4%) shares surge to the top of the S&P after a study shows...

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +5.4%) shares surge to the top of the S&P after a study shows elderly patients receiving its Sapien heart valve implanted through the ribs as part of an expanded access program reaped more benefit than those observed in initial trials. Cannacord, which rates shares a Buy, thinks the data will ease FDA concerns, and raises its target price to $95 from $90.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP +1.8%) trades higher after the FDA accepts its Gattex drug application...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP +1.8%) trades higher after the FDA accepts its Gattex drug application for review. Slicing through the firm's statement a bit - it appears that it didn't land a coveted "priority" review from the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • LXK

    More on Lexmark's (NYSE:LXK) Q4: Guidance for Q1 revenue sees decline of 4%-6%, in line with...

    More on ARM's Q4: Expects Q1 revenue to be in-line with expectations of ~$200M, and 2012 revenue to be "at least in-line" with expectations of ~$860M. 2.2B ARM-based chips shipped in Q4, up 22% Y/Y. Royalty/chip was 7.1 cents, up slightly Q/Q. 25 new CPU licenses, down slightly from Q3's 28. Cortex CPUs (generate higher royalties) accounted for 23% of chips, up from 13% a year ago. ARMH +4.6%. (PR)

  • The S&P 500's 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day moving average and creates the...

    The S&P 500's 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day moving average and creates the "Golden Cross," the market's favorite bullish technical indicator. Although it's not infallible, Birinyi analysts note that stocks have, on average, gained 6.6% following the 26 Golden Crosses that have occurred since 1962.
